quest.name: A Burst of Inspiration
journal: Inspector Briardien would share with you his latest findings.

Your and Ellie's plan to steer Briardien clear of the concealed explosives was for naught, as the inspector cut a straight path for that very location, hoping to speak with the two of you where the conversation might not be overheard. Lead him clear of the bombs before disaster ensues.

Ellie's attempt to lead Briardien away from the explosives has the opposite effect when the inspector responds to her shivers by offering to build a fire. A piece of driftwood conveniently left on the beach by Nashu making the process far easier than it should be, in moments Briardien stands before the crates with a flaming torch in his hand.

The ridiculously inauspicious turn of events has only begun, however, as a sudden gust of wind proceeds to carry three all-too-easily-misread pages of Nashu's journal onto the sands at Briardien's feet. Reading them and believing his life to be in imminent danger, Briardien hurls the flaming torch into the heavens in an uncharacteristic moment of panic. Ellie moves quickly, shoving the inspector out of harm's way, but placing herself into it. Always the gentleman, Hildibrand comes to the rescue of the distressed damsel by attempting to catch the torch, gloriously tripping over his own two feet in the process. The flaming torch comes hurtling down like Dalamud, just evading Hildibrand's desperate grasp before striking the ground between his hands, bouncing up, and somehow landing in perfect balance atop the Manderville man's pate.

No sooner does everyone breathe a sigh of relief than is Nashu unable to contain a sneeze, causing Hildibrand to flinch, the torch to fall, and everything in sight to be blown to the seventh hell. Miraculously, there are no casualties save for the crates of foodstuffs. Incensed at your meddling, Master Guguremu orders you to have the supplies replaced, with harsh consequences awaiting you should the feast be called off due to your high jinks.

Lewenhart explains that among the foodstuffs lost in the explosion were rare imported vegetables that could not possibly be ordered in time for the feast. Hildibrand, ever quick to act, suggests that the only logical recourse is to reclaim the initial lost shipment from the clutches of the Mandragoras, and goes one step further by boldly volunteering you for the task. Seek out a Yellowjacket by the name of Sundhimal at the Limsa Lominsa lower decks, that you might track down the lair of this band of bloodthirsty flora freedom fighters.

Sundhimal informs you that the Mandragoras were last seen commandeering a poor merchant's boat with which they absconded a haul of stolen produce, almost certainly purloined from Costa del Sol. The hapless victim set sail for Aleport a short while ago. Seek him out and inquire as to the rogue vegetables' destination.

The tiny trader recounts for you the story of his frightening encounter with the Mandragoras, which has left him a ruined man. Lend an ear to the man's tale of woe, that it might lead you in the direction of your quarry.
objectives: Speak with Sundhimal at the Limsa Lominsa lower decks.
Speak with the tiny trader in Aleport.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...So Hildibrand has managed thus far not to destroy anything. Consider me something almost resembling impressed.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Haha, i-indeed! But enough about Hildibrand! Forename and I have been waiting to hear your latest theories. We should go somewhere quiet and─

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: An excellent idea, Miss Ellie. Ah, yes─that spot just over there by the crates should suffice.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Th-There, of all places? But surely we could find somewhere more scenic!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I am not here on vacation─I am here to solve a case. Besides, we cannot afford to have our conversation overheard. That junk–littered beach should afford us some welcome privacy.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, Inspector. Privacy, indeed...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Bloody hells! Don't worry, Forename. I'll figure out some way to lead him clear of the bombs.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: All we have to do is lure him away from these crates. That shouldn't be too difficult...r-right?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Worry not, my friend! Should anything threaten to put you or Miss Ellie in harm's way, Nashu and I stand at the ready!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I think the tide is rising! W-We really should move to higher ground...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Is it just me, or is there a bit of a chill in the air? P-Perhaps we should go someplace warm...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I, for one, welcome a respite from the sweltering heat. Besides, this will not take long.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> If you insist, Inspector...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Through the questioning of a Brass Blade attacked by our quarry, I have identified the three individuals most likely to be our thief in disguise.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: To wit: Morgant, Yalto Nolto, and Lewenhart. The three of us shall split up, with each of us keeping watch over...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. Are the two of you listening?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: O-Of course we are! Beg pardon, Inspector.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: You look unwell, Miss Ellie. Perhaps you were right─I, too, feel a chill wind blowing in. Mayhap we should continue our conversation elsewhere...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Ah, but there is no need. Wait here, and I shall build us a fire.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah! Methinks the inspector has taken leave of his senses! The chance of locating suitable kindling on these barren shores is infinitesimal!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Here we are. This piece of driftwood should serve perfectly. And as fortune would have it, I just happen to have a flint stone on my person.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: There is no cause for alarm! 'Tis not blood that courses through the inspector's veins, but ice! I could not fathom a series of events that would lead such a calm and composed individual to lose his firm grip on that fiery torch!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Remarkable insight, Inspector! I must record these words for posterity!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Whee! It's flying!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Mm? What have we here?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: “Everything is proceeding according to my master plan”...!?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Could this be...? Another challenge from the fiend!?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: S-Surely you jest, Inspector! It looks nothing like his usual cards, see? Doubtless it's just the idle ravings of some madman!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps so, but we must exercise due caution. Ah, there are two more pages.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: “Give up hope. He of many faces will laugh last. It is not the lapis maiden alone that shall come to harm”...!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: It is more direct than his previous challenges, but there can be no doubt as to the sender. But what is this talk of another victim? The final page holds the answer, no doubt.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The final...page...?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: “Confounding Inspector Briardien will...meet...a...fiery...demise.”

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Uwaaaaaah!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: You...you saw through the fiend's ruse. But how?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Er, let's just call it reporter's intuition. Are you hurt?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: A ringing in my ears, but otherwise no worse for the wear. You...you have my gratitude.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Hildibrand Manderville. Were you able to learn aught of the fiend who made this ignoble attempt on my life?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I exhausted every effort, Inspector, yet I fear our quarry proves ever elusive!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Excellent. I might have died of shock if you had. At any rate, our foe has revealed himself as no mere thief, but a madman who will resort to cold–blooded murder. We must redouble our vigilance, lest the others come to harm.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Vigilance! Yes, vigilance is the order of the day!

dialogue.name: GUGUREMU
dialogue.text: What in the name of the gods─ Thal's teeth! Those vegetables cost a fortune! And they're ruined! Ruined!

dialogue.name: GUGUREMU
dialogue.text: Agent of enquiry!? More like agent of injury and incompetence! You are to replace the supplies that you destroyed before the banquet begins, or I will see the entire lot of you rot in gaol!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Thanks to our quick thinking, the bombs are no more and the inspector is none the wiser! 'Tis a shame to see good food go to waste, though─those coconuts looked positively luscious!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Clearly, our thief has decided that my prodigious intellect presents the greatest threat to his schemes. Perhaps he is a more clever man than I thought.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Is that a fish? I'm getting hungry...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I would ask how he survived an explosion at point–blank range, but something tells me that's one more mystery better left unsolved.

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: What was that terrible explosion coming from the beach!? Is everyone safe?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Fear not─the fiend's artless attempt on my life has been thwarted. Sadly, your food supply did not escape unscathed. Master Guguremu bids that the damaged ingredients be replaced with all speed.

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: G-Good gods... This is no thief─this is a madman! As for replacing the ingredients, I fear that will prove a difficult task. Those crates contained imported vegetables of considerable rarity, you see.

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: Vegetables that are in particularly short supply these days, what with the Mandragoras at large. Even if I were to place the order immediately, it would likely take days to arrive.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: The Mandragoras...? I have heard of that fell band. Tell me: what manner of vegetables did they steal?

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: The rarest was an import from the Far East. I do not recall the name, but it very closely resembled the Eorzean dragon pepper─save for its color, which was a deep purple.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Methinks you dost worry too much, Master Lewenhart! Our course of action is clear: we need only storm into the den of these overgrown weeds and steal your precious purple dragon peppers right back!

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: I would advise against that, Inspector. These are no ordinary mandragoras, but rather a bloodthirsty band of killers given succulent flesh! Even the Brass Blades of the Gerbera proved unable to resist them.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oho─a formidable foe, indeed! Were only there a brave soul in our midst with a wont for taking on fearsome enemies with not a shred of concern for herhis own well–being...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Your eyes, friend, they speak to me! They say, “I─yes, I─shall vanquish these rogue vegetables and deliver the purloined goods back to their rightful owner!”

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: You are truly a godssend, adventurer! One Sundhimal of the Yellowjackets has been charged with defending the roads from the Mandragoras. If anyone would have knowledge of their current whereabouts, it would be him.

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: Without those ingredients, Master Guguremu is like to cook me instead! Please, friend, you're my only hope!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: A gentleman would never let a ladyhis comrade face danger alone. Let us away to Limsa together!

dialogue.name: LEWENHART
dialogue.text: One Sundhimal of the Yellowjackets has been charged with defending the roads from the Mandragoras. If anyone had knowledge of their current whereabouts, it would be him.

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: If you've come for the Mandragoras, I fear you're half a bell too late. As were we, blast it all!

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: To hear the poor merchant tell it, no sooner had he opened his cargo hold to check on a shipment of vegetables than did an onion turn on him, screeching bloody murder.

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: Fled his own vessel in sheer terror, he did. By the time he came to his senses, it had set sail without him.

dialogue.name: SUNDHIMAL
dialogue.text: The merchant left for Aleport, hoping to recoup his losses. If you've a mind to go after the culprits, you might lend an ear to his sad tale.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)Ahhh! Is the thrill of the chase not invigorating, friend!? The ferry docked by Fisherman's Bottom will carry us to Aleport. Let us be swiftly on our way!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01439
dialogue.text: Eeek! Don't sneak up on me like that! I thought ye were a feral turnip, a murderous eggplant, or summat like that!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01439
dialogue.text: Think I jest, do ye? Ye'd be singin' a different tune if a shot o' tomato juice almost took out yer eye, as it did mine! My eye!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01439
dialogue.text: By the time I'd regained me wits, they'd already set sail with me ship and me livelihood. I'm ruined─ruined! If I never see another bleedin' onion till the end o' me days, it'll be too soon.
